analyzed: yadi bhāgya vaśāt devi labhyate vā na labhyate  dīkṣitām devatā bhaktām ghṛṇā lajjā vivarjitām
translated: If, O Goddess, she is obtained by the power of fate or not obtained,🔽having approached the initiated one, devoted to the deity, free from hatred and shame,

analyzed: japa āsaktām samāsādya sarve saṃsādhayet śive
translated: addicted to japa, O Goddess, one should accomplish everything.

translated: Having performed nyasa etc. in her, the digits of Kama and Soma, etc.,🔽having combed the hair, one should arrange the offerings.🔽Having touched, one should perform japa. By worship, it becomes.

analyzed: pūjām jānīhi deveśi tayā uktam yogam ācaret

translated: Worship, japa, cow-related rituals, tarpaṇa, mārjana,

translated: entering is the homa ritual, tarpaṇa would be

analyzed: sahasram ca śatam netra pañcāśat adhikam śive

analyzed: tad rūpa pūjanāt devi pūjitāḥ sarva yoṣitaḥ

analyzed: pūrva uktam atra paśūnām divyānām etat eva tu

analyzed: pṛthvī pradakṣiṇā devi paśūnām parikīrtitā

analyzed: śivaḥ eva vijānāti phala bāhulyam atra tu

analyzed: smaraṇāt bhāṣaṇāt devi trailokyam pūjitam bhavet

analyzed: kāmaḥ dvāram maheśāni tathā daśa rasā śive

analyzed: mānasam bhrāmaram proktam gatayaḥ pakṣiṇaḥ smṛtāḥ

analyzed: rāgatālāḥ ca rāgiṇyaḥ tat vārttā ālāpanam bhavet

analyzed: sthānāt sthāna antare yānam anubhāvāḥ prakīrtitāḥ

analyzed: mālā truṭiḥ bhavet māno tad natiḥ hā nāyakaḥ
translated: The breakage of the garland is considered to be the honor, and its bending is the leader.

analyzed: mālatī ādīni puṣpāṇi rati hāsī bhavanti ca
translated: The flowers such as Malati, etc. are the smiles of Rati.

original: evaṃ sarvaṃ tu vijñāya pañcagandhādyakaṃ śive // //
analyzed: evam sarvam tu vijñāya pañcagandha ādyakam śive
translated: Thus knowing everything, O Shiva, with the five scents etc.

analyzed: tuṣṭiḥ prasanna tā proktā nindā kṣobhaḥ prakīrtitaḥ

analyzed: tāṭasthyam ca eva vaimukhyam śakti rūpam prakīrtitam
translated: Neutrality and aversion are proclaimed to be the form of Shakti.

analyzed: āgneyī svargaḥ iti uktaḥ saurīyā nara loka tā

analyzed: bindu dharmaḥ tu parjanyaḥ sarvam saṃkṣepataḥ matam
translated: The dharma of the bindu is Parjanya, and everything is considered in brief.

analyzed: śayanam krīḍanam na atryam kāvyam tad rūpa cintanam
translated: Sleeping, playing, singing, poetry, and contemplating on that form,

analyzed: kāvya ālāpāḥ ca ye kecid gīta kāvya akhilāni ca
translated: and all the songs and poems that are sung,

analyzed: śabda mūrti dharasya ete viṣṇoḥ aṃśāḥ mahātmanaḥ
translated: These are the parts of the great-souled Vishnu, who has the form of sound.

analyzed: punar punar kim vaktavyam trailokyam tad mayam bhavet  /

translated: Elsewhere, the exit is liberation for the deluded ones who suffer.

analyzed: ajñānāt api deveśi phalam evam prayacchati
translated: Even through ignorance, O Goddess of the Lord, it grants such fruit.

analyzed: jñānāt eva maheśāni kim tat yat na kare sthitam
translated: O Mahesani, what is it that is not in the hand of one who has knowledge?

analyzed: triṃśat urvuda ṣaṭpadma pañcavṛnda arbudāni ca

analyzed: medhā dīkṣā ādibhiḥ yuktaḥ tasya jñānam prakāśate
translated: Endowed with the initiation of meditation and so on, his knowledge shines forth.

analyzed: jñānāt kīṭaḥ api nirmuktaḥ tad yogam śṛṇu pārvati
translated: Even an insect is liberated through knowledge. Listen to that yoga, O Parvati.

original: jīvaḥ kīṭaḥ purā bhūtvā bhramaraṃ paśyati priye /
analyzed: jīvaḥ kīṭaḥ purā bhūtvā bhramaram paśyati priye

analyzed: tad ālokana sadbhāvāt bhramara tvam prajāyate

analyzed: punar kīṭaḥ na hi bhavet tāruṇya rūpa tām gataḥ

analyzed: śūnyasya bhāvanā devi śūnya rūpaḥ hi nīrasaḥ
translated: O Goddess, the meditation on emptiness is indeed the formless essence.

analyzed: yathā bhavati deveśi bhāva yoga utra kāraṇam
translated: O Goddess of the Lord, it becomes so by the yoga of devotion here, the cause.

analyzed: brahmāṇḍa rūpā yā śaktiḥ para brahma svarūpiṇī
translated: The power that is in the form of the universe, which is of the nature of the Supreme Brahman,

analyzed: cit śaktiḥ iti vijñātā śūnyam tasyāḥ tu koṇa gam

analyzed: ananta koṭi saṃkhyātāḥ bhramarāḥ yad mukha udbhavāḥ
translated: The bees that emerge from its mouth are innumerable in number,

analyzed: tasyāḥ para svarūpiṇyāḥ sadbhāvam tu samabhyaset

analyzed: sugamaḥ yam paraḥ bhāvaḥ cetanā puruṣaḥ api vā
translated: This Supreme Reality is easily accessible, or even the conscious person,

analyzed: śiva rūpaḥ sa ca proktaḥ sarva siddhiḥ maheśvari
translated: is said to be of the form of Shiva, O Great Goddess, the attainment of all perfections.

analyzed: bhāva yogāt bhavet medhā dīkṣā sarva uttama uttamā

the queen of knowledge, Shodashi, the seer, Kaama-Kalika,
the mistress of feet, Hansa-Kali, having the form of four feet,

analyzed: kubjikā guhyakālī ca medhādīkṣā samācaret

analyzed: ubhayatra kramāt medhā dīkṣā proktā maheśvari

analyzed: jīvaḥ kīṭaḥ purā bhūtvā bhṛgi tvam abhigacchati
translated: Having been a worm in the past, he attains the state of a bee.

analyzed: tatas ṣaṭcakra sambhedam kṛtvā tad rasa bhuj bhavet
translated: Then, having made the union of the six cakras, he becomes the enjoyer of their essence.
